name: Exploring Saigon's Traditional Street Bazaars
description: Traditional street bazaars are crucial part of Saigon's commercial activites, especially for the Saigon's citizens. Like "36 ancient towns" in Hanoi, those bazaars share a few distinct traits in common. This trip offers you guys 5 traditional, unique bazaars. Each bazaar solely sell one kind of good, they are: Le Cong Kieu St. (antiques), Yersin St. (specialties), Hai Thuong Lan Ong St. (herbalism), Soai Kinh Lam bazaar (fabrics), and Luong Nhu Hoc St. (lanterns). There are also stories lying behind them. Traditional bazaars partially contribute to the prosperity of Saigon in XIX-XX century. While looking around the sights, visitors may grab a chance to dine out several truly, authentic Vietnamese, and Chinese tastes lasting nearly 80 years until now. This trip are customized in the local style and roughly takes 5 hours to set out. You wanna experience as a local? Let's roll!
